setPreSignature(bytes,bool).details: Sets a presignature for the specified order UID.

params.orderUid: The unique identifier of the order to pre-sign.

documentation.text:
@dev The EIP-712 domain type hash used for computing the domain
 separator.
@dev The EIP-712 domain name used for computing the domain separator.
@dev The EIP-712 domain version used for computing the domain separator.
@dev Marker value indicating an order is pre-signed.

@dev The domain separator used for signing orders that gets mixed in
 making signatures for different domains incompatible. This domain
 separator is computed following the EIP-712 standard and has replay
 protection mixed in so that signed orders are only valid for specific
 GPv2 contracts.

@dev Storage indicating whether or not an order has been signed by a
 particular address.

@dev Event that is emitted when an account either pre-signs an order or
 revokes an existing pre-signature.

@dev Sets a presignature for the specified order UID.
 @param orderUid The unique identifier of the order to pre-sign.

function (struct GPv2Order.Data memory,enum GPv2Signing.Scheme,bytes calldata) view returns (bytes32,address)

documentation.text: @dev The length of any signature from an externally owned account.
